intro: Dioscorea holtii, commonly known as the Mexican yam, is a climbing vine native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are the primary storage organs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers and has compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its tubers are sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Dioscorea holtii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
